description: Release of tor 0.2.2.22-alpha. Changes the TLS Diffie–Hellman parameter to match that used by Apache mod_ssl, to evade blocking in Iran.
Release of tor 0.2.3.4-alpha. Changes the expiration time of TLS certificates, to evade blocking in Iran.
Kazakhstan blocks Tor TLS by ClientHello and ServerHello fingerprints.
Ethiopia blocks Tor TLS.
Release of tor 0.2.3.17-beta. Changes the TLS ciphersuite list to match that of Firefox 8, to evade blocking by China.

Relay users increase globally from about 800K to over 5M, when computers in the Mevade/Sefnit botnet began using Tor to communicate. The user count decreased in the following months through efforts to clean up the botnet. Sometime in 2014-04, the botnet switched from using Tor to using SSH.
Microsoft adds the Mevade/Sefnit botnet signature to various security scanners.
Microsoft adds the Mevade/Sefnit botnet signature to their Malicious Software Removal Tool.
First public announcement of meek.
Began running meek-server on bridge already hosting websocket-server for flash proxy.
Reinstalled the bridge running meek and flash proxy.
Set up meek-amazon CDN configuration.
Tor Browser 3.6.4 released.
Tor Browser 4.0-alpha-1 released. This is the first release to have meek built in.
'How to use the “meek” pluggable transport' blog post is published.
Decrease in fte users, perhaps caused by an outage of one of the default Tor Browser bridges.
Split the bridge running meek and flashproxy into separate processes in order to avoid spurious correlation in user counts.
Switched meek-amazon to HTTPS.
Changed the bridge backing meek-amazon.
Enabled PublishServerDescriptor on the meek-amazon bridge. Between 2014-09-29 and 2014-10-14, meek-amazon users were not being counted.
Tor Browser 4.0 released. This is the first stable release with meek built in.
Changed the bridge backing meek-google.
Changed the meek-google App Engine instance to the F2 class, from F1.
Changed the meek-google App Engine instance back to the F1 class, from F2.
Changed the meek-google App Engine instance to the F2 class again, from F1.
Changed the meek-google App Engine instance back to the F1 class, from F2.
Moved the meek-google bridge to better hardware.
Altered performance settings on the meek-google App Engine instance in an effort to reduce instance hours. Set max idle instances to 4 and min pending latency to 500 ms.
Implemented persistent connections for meek-azure, increasing performance.
Tor Weekly News covers the meek-azure performance improvement.
Rate-limited the meek-google bridge to 1.5 MB/s.
Further rate-limited meek-google to 1.1 MB/s, from 1.5 MB/s.
Rate-limited the meek-amazon bridge to 1.1 MB/s.
Outage of meek-azure.
Published a workaround for the meek-azure outage that started 2015-07-20.
Tor Browser 5.0 and 5.5a1 released. They have an updated configuration to work around the meek-azure outage that started 2015-07-20.
Upgraded meek-azure bridge from KVM to Xen.

Outage of meek-amazon caused by an expired certificate. As a result of being rebooted, the bridge also changes its fingerprint from 4EE0CC769EB4B15A872F742EDE27D298A59DCADE to 6DDD1DB8526282837C50E9AB5D14AB50150CD624.

The fingerprint of the meek-amazon bridge changes, as a result of begin rebooted. Released Tor Browsers with the former fingerprint are unable to connect. The fingerprint changed from 4EE0CC769EB4B15A872F742EDE27D298A59DCADE to 6DDD1DB8526282837C50E9AB5D14AB50150CD624, then again to B9E7141C594AF25699E0079C1F0146F409495296. The new fingerprint shipped with Tor Browser 5.0.4 and 5.5a4 on 2015-11-04.
Rate-limited the meek-azure bridge to 1.1 MB/s. (Azure grant expired.)

Altered the performance settings on the meek-google App Engine instance. Set max idle instances to 2 and min pending latency to 1000 ms. This used to be configured through the web interface but is now configured in an application file, which at some point caused the settings from 2015-02-28 to be lost.
Further rate-limited the meek-azure bridge to 0.8 MB/s, from 1.1 MB/s.
Tor Browser 5.0.4 and 5.5a4 released, containing a fixed fingerprint for meek-amazon.
Bangladesh blocks Facebook, WhatsApp, and Viber.
Enabled client IP statistics on the meek-azure bridge.
Enabled client IP statistics on the meek-google bridge.
Established an unthrottled bridge C20658946DD706A7A2181159A1A04CD838570D04 for people who set up their own meek CDN configuration.
Enabled client IP statistics on the meek-amazon bridge.
Increased rate limit of the meek-azure bridge to 3 MB/s, from 0.8 MB/s.
Increased rate limit of the meek-google bridge to 3 MB/s, from 1.1 MB/s.
Increased rate limit of the meek-amazon bridge to 3 MB/s, from 1.1 MB/s.
Temporary blocking of an Azure edge server in China.
Social media blackout in Uganda during presidential election.
Outage of meek-azure bridge, caused by an expired TLS certificate.
Temporarily ran an experimental branch for IPv6 counting on the meek-azure bridge.
Tor Browser 6.0a5 and 6.0a5-hardened released, which lacks the fte pluggable transport on Mac.
WhatsApp block in Brazil
Social media blackout in Uganda following presidential inauguration.
meek-google's App Engine instance is suspended and meek-google stops working.
Tor Browser 6.0 released, which lacks the fte pluggable transport on Mac.
Kazakhstan blocks vanilla Tor TLS. Users mostly switch to obfs4.
Coup attempt in Turkey. A paper (§ 4.1) reports a decline in Tor users.
Changed the meek-amazon CDN price class from "All" to "Use Only US, Canada and Europe."
Iran somehow blocks most direct Tor connections. May also affect bridge users, but it's hard to tell because there were few vanilla bridge users anyway.
tor 0.2.8.7 and 0.2.9.2-alpha are released, changing the bridge authority from Tonga to Bifroest.
CollecTor begins publishing bridge stats from the new bridge authority Bifroest.

The former bridge authority Tonga shuts down. Bridges that have not updated to tor 0.2.8.7 or 0.2.9.2-alpha (which include all 5 default obfs3 bridges and 3/16 default obfs4 bridges) stop reporting statistics.

Iran intensifies the blocking begun on 2016-08-20, getting most of the remaining direct users. There is interference in the graphs from the bridge authority changeover on 2016-09-02, but because the changeover would not have affected counts of ''direct'' users, it may be a coincidence.
macOS 10.12 (Sierra) is released, breaking some programs that are built with Go <1.7, including the meek-client that comes with Tor Browser. (See 2016-11-15 unbreaking event.)
Default obfs3 bridges ndnop0 and ndnop2 upgrade and begin reporting statistics to the new bridge authority Bifroest.
Default obfs3 bridges ndnop3 and ndnop5 upgrade and begin reporting statistics to the new bridge authority Bifroest.
Default obfs3 bridges "Unnamed" and "Unnamed" (fingerprint AF9F66B7B04F8FF6F32D455F05135250A16543C9) upgrade and begin reporting statistics to the new bridge authority Bifroest.

Outage of default obfs3 bridges "Unnamed" and "Unnamed" (fingerprint AF9F66B7B04F8FF6F32D455F05135250A16543C9). (Start date not known for sure, though it must have been after 2016-09-23; discussed in non-archived tor-team email.)
Default obfs3 bridge LeifEricson upgrades and begins reporting statistics to the new bridge authority Bifroest. This is the last obfs3 bridge that hadn't upgraded.
Default obfs4 bridge LeifEricson upgrades and begins reporting statistics to the new bridge authority Bifroest. This is the last obfs4 bridge that hadn't upgraded.
Rate limit on the meek-amazon bridge returns to 3.0 MB/s, having been set to about 1.0 MB/s for some time, cause uncertain.
Reports that direct connections from Egypt are blocked; bridges are required. Maybe be the same as the block beginning 2016-10-25.
Ethiopia declares a state of emergency and implements network blocks.
Turkey blocks storage services including Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, and GitHub. Most (all?) of the blocks were rescinded the next day.
Large decrease in meek users, perhaps caused by problems in Orbot 15.0.2 BETA 1 that were fixed in Orbot 15.2.0 RC8.
Egypt blocks Tor directory authorities and public relays by TCP RST. Bridges work.
Decreased the rate limit on the meek-amazon bridge to 1.0 MB/s, from 3.0 MB/s.
Increased the rate limit on the meek-amazon bridge to 3.0 MB/s, from 1.0 MB/s.
Turkey blocks Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, WhatsApp
Turkey orders a block on VPN services and Tor
Tor Browser 6.0.6 is released, unbreaking meek on macOS 10.12 (Sierra). (See 2016-09-20 breaking event.)
Default obfs4 bridges ndnop3 and ndnop5 turn on timing obfuscation (iat-mode).
Default obfs4 bridge Lisbeth turns on timing obfuscation (iat-mode=1).
Decreased the rate limit on the meek-amazon bridge to 2.0 MB/s, from 3.0 MB/s.
Internet shutdown in Gambia.
Belarus blocks the addresses of public Tor relays, apparently by RST injection. Bridges work, even unobfuscated ones.
Turkey blocks direct Tor connections. The order to block had come on 2016-11-04.
The Democratic Republic of the Congo orders a block of social media services.
Decreased the rate limit on the meek-azure bridge to 2.0 MB/s, from 3.0 MB/s.
1.0-beta release of GAEuploader, a tool that automates the setting up of meek.
Tor Browser 7.0a1 released, including Snowflake for GNU/Linux only.
Measurement error from bandwidth authority causes decrease in measured bandwidth in Europe.
Stopped the meek-azure CDN endpoint az668014.vo.msecnd.net.
Stopped the meek-azure CDN endpoint az786092.vo.msecnd.net.
Stopped the (unused) meek-azure CDN endpoint meek-reflect.azureedge.net.
Tor Browser 6.5.1 is released, containing the new meek-azure CDN configuration, and removing the last remaining scramblesuit bridge.
Orbot 15.4.0 beta-2 multi is released, containing the new meek-azure CDN configuration.
Directory authority maatuska's bwscanner stops operating, leading to a drop in traffic on some relays.
The meek-amazon bridge upgrades to meek-server 0.27.
Set AssumeReachable 1 on the Snowflake bridge 2B280B23E1107BB62ABFC40DDCC8824814F80A72 in an attempt to make it start publishing statistics.

Ukraine blocks Russian-operated web services. Relay and bridge users increase over 5×. May be partly attributable to the FreeU Browser , a browser produced and advertised by Mail.ru that includes a tor client.

Default obfs4 bridge LeifEricson rejects connections due to a broken firewall forwarding rule. This didn't affect the bridges "real" obfs4 port, but it did affect the port at that time configured in Tor Browser.
Set AssumeReachable 1 on the default obfs4 bridges cymrubridge31 and cymrubridge33 in an attempt to make them publish statistics.
Tor Browser 7.0 released. Adds an IPv6 address for default obfs4 bridge Lisbeth. Adds new default obfs4 bridges frosty and dragon.
Increased the file descriptor limit on default obfs4 bridges ndnop3 and ndnop5 from 4096 to 32768. They had been failing bootstrap attempts from a test location in the U.S. about 40% of the time.
Outage of default obfs4 bridge frosty.
Outage of default obfs4 bridge dragon.
Outage of meek-azure bridge.
Outage of default obfs4 bridge frosty.
Outage of default obfs4 bridge dragon.
deb.torproject.org upgrades from tor 0.2.9 to tor 0.3.0
Outage of default obfs4 bridge dragon.
Outage of default obfs4 bridge frosty.
Outage of meek-amazon bridge, caused by an expired certificate.
Tor Browser 7.5a4 released, including Snowflake for macOS.
Outage of the bridge authority Bifroest.
A flood of over 4,000 obfs4 bridges nicknamed "Machiavelli".
Outage of the bridge authority Bifroest.
Large drop in direct users in Turkmenistan.

Sustained increase in meek users in Brazil. Locals believe that they are not actual users, rather bots or something like that. End date coincides with shutdown of meek-azure before migration. Would pick up again 2017-06-07.
Sudden increase of direct and bridge users in Mali.
Large decrease in users in China.
Direct users fluctuate wildly in Israel. Bridge users not affected.
Decrease in direct users and increase in bridge users in Saudi Arabia.
Decrease in direct users and increase in bridge users in Saudi Arabia. The increase in bridge users lasts only about one month while the number of direct users remains down.
Drop in relay users.
Huge increase in relay users (200k+).
Increase in obfs3 users from the UAE, from 5K to 100K. Other transports not affected.
Gradual but large increase of obfs3 users in India, followed by slow decay. Relay users and other transports seemingly not affected.
Abrupt increase and decrease in obfs3 users in Jordan. Relay users and other transports seemingly not affected.
Sudden increase of direct users in Israel. Bridge users not affected.
Another sudden increase of direct users in Israel. Bridge users not affected.
Direct users fluctuate widely in Taiwan after a 3× sudden increase.
Sudden temporary peak of 3k direct users in Macau.
Drop in direct users from Egypt.
Sustained increase of meek users in Brazil, similar to the one that took place between 2016-07-21 and 2017-03-03.
Increase in obfs4 users in Switzerland, from 200 to 400.
Sudden increase of direct and bridge users in Mali.
Increase of relay users in the Seychelles, from 400 to 6000. Bridge users not affected.
Directory authorities using 2× bandwidth.
links: post suggesting link to nl, ro, lt, sc increases

description: Increase of relay users in the Netherlands, from 50k to 100k.
Increase of relay users in Romania, from 10k to 40k. Bridge users not affected.
Increase of relay users in Lithuania, from 2k to 70k. Bridge users not affected.
Further increase of relay users in the Seychelles, from 5k to 100k. Bridge users not affected.
Fluctuations of relay users in Austria. Bridge users not affected.
Triple increase in direct Tor users in Hong Kong. Bridge users not affected.
Jump in IPv6 users of the Lisbeth default obfs4 bridge.
Short-lived, simultaneous spike in direct users in Egypt and Turkey. Bridge users not affected.
